channel.title: An good question!?!?
channel.description:
I have almost got my server ready.
My question is:
To be able to get users to access my private server ONLINE.. do i HAVE to sign up to no-ip, and do all this portforwarding garbage is can i just simply RUN my server on a website host (like 000webhosts) and not have to worry about portforawding ect)????

item.title: An good question!?!?
item.dc:creator: @aquatizscape aquatizscape
item.description:
@aquatizscape wrote:

^True.
But, You can buy a dedicated host, and host your server 100% with that.
They are a little prices though

Read full topic

item.title: An good question!?!?
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

You can’t run a server off a web host. No-ip is just name servers so you can have a pretty name direct to your IP the only thing you really need to do though is port-forward.

Read full topic

item.title: An good question!?!?
item.dc:creator: @aquatizscape aquatizscape
item.description:
@aquatizscape wrote:

Simply follow these steps.

  1. Go Here www.no-ip.com
    2.Make a Ip, and download the ip client.
    3.Open up no-ip’s client, and put a check next to the smiley face.
    FINISHED WITH THAT PART.
    Next,
    1 Open up command prompt.
  2. Type in ipconfig
    3, hit enter
    4 look for your default gateway number. It will say default gateway.
  3. type that into your browser in internet explorer.
  4. Go to like virtual servers, or whatever your router is like.
  5. MAke one that says RSPS and ports are 43594.
  6. select TCP.
  7. Save changed.
    Congradulations!

Read full topic
